data.title: Wall Street Week Highlights Importance of Acknowledging Mistakes
data.description: David Westin emphasized the significance of recognizing and owning mistakes during this week's Wall Street Week. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting Westin's discussion on how acknowledging errors can lead to growth and improvement in the financial sector. The conversation underscored the value of transparency and accountability in business practices, suggesting that admitting faults can foster trust and credibility among stakeholders. This approach is seen as crucial for navigating the complexities of the financial markets and maintaining a resilient economic environment.

data.title: India's Anticipated Temperature Rise May Increase Power Demand and Health Risks
data.description: India is expected to experience above-normal temperatures in the upcoming months, which could lead to increased power demand and significant health risks for its residents. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting concerns about the potential impact on the country's energy consumption and public health. The forecast suggests that the higher temperatures may strain the power grid as demand for cooling systems rises. Additionally, the heat poses a serious threat to public health, particularly for vulnerable populations. Authorities are urged to prepare for these challenges to mitigate the effects on both infrastructure and citizens.

data.title: Tanker shipping in the Strait of Hormuz has come to a standstill.
data.description: According to real-time data from the international tanker traffic monitoring system, the speed of tankers in the waters surrounding the Strait of Hormuz has generally dropped to zero, indicating that shipping in the region has come to a standstill. Meanwhile, several European governments have issued emergency orders to their tankers flying their national flags, prohibiting them from passing through the Strait of Hormuz to avoid the security risks posed by the escalating situation. (CCTV News)

data.title: Concerns Over National Security's Impact on Election Control
data.description: The Constitution grants states the authority to manage elections, with Congress holding the power to amend these rules. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting concerns that using 'national security' as a justification to alter this framework could be both illegal and authoritarian. Legal experts warn against undermining the constitutional design, emphasizing the importance of maintaining the established balance of power between state and federal authorities.

data.title: China and India Hold Strategic Talks Ahead of BRICS Chairmanship Transition
data.description: China has initiated strategic discussions with India as the latter prepares to take over the chairmanship of BRICS in 2026. India's presidency in 2026 is set to prioritize resilience, innovation, cooperation, and sustainability to enhance the group's global influence.

data.title: Dune Data Reveals Insights into $304 Billion Stablecoin Market
data.description: PANews posted on X (formerly Twitter). Recent data from Dune Analytics has unveiled significant insights into the $304 billion stablecoin market. Key findings highlight a duopoly, with USDT and USDC commanding an 89% market share. Despite over 172 million global wallet addresses, emerging stablecoins like USDS and USD0 see over 90% of their supply concentrated in the top 10 wallets. In January, stablecoin transfers exceeded $10.3 trillion, with USDC's transaction volume nearly five times that of USDT, indicating its role as a highly active trading medium. More than 90% of stablecoins are actively utilized in decentralized exchange liquidity, lending leverage, and centralized exchange channels, rather than remaining idle.

data.title: Bitcoin Funding Rate Plunges to -6% as BTC Dips to $63K, Short Squeeze Risk Builds
data.description: Bitcoin’s perpetual funding rate dropped to -6% after BTC briefly fell to $63,000, signaling extreme bearish positioning and raising the potential for a short squeeze.The sharp move followed geopolitical escalation involving U.S. and Israeli strikes on Iran, which triggered volatility across risk assets.Funding Rate Hits Second-Lowest Level in 3 MonthsAccording to data from CoinGlass, the perpetual contract funding rate fell to -6%, marking the second-lowest level in nearly three months.The last time funding rates reached similar levels was on February 6, when Bitcoin bottomed near $60,000 before staging a rebound.A deeply negative funding rate means:Short sellers are paying longs to maintain positionsBearish positioning is crowdedMarket sentiment is skewed toward downside expectationsHistorically, extreme negative funding has often preceded sharp countertrend rallies as overleveraged shorts unwind.Open Interest Rises as Liquidations Exceed $500MDespite the price drop, coin-denominated open interest increased significantly:Open interest rose from 668,000 BTC to 687,000 BTC in 24 hoursMore than $500 million in crypto positions were liquidatedOver $420 million were long liquidationsThe combination of rising open interest and negative funding suggests new short positions are entering the market aggressively rather than traders closing exposure.This dynamic increases the probability of a short squeeze if Bitcoin reclaims key resistance levels.BTC Attempts to Reclaim $64,000After briefly dipping to $63,000, Bitcoin is now attempting to reclaim the $64,000 level.If price momentum strengthens:Shorts may be forced to coverFunding rates could normalize rapidlyLiquidation cascades may push BTC higherHowever, failure to hold support could embolden bears and trigger further downside.Market Structure Points to Elevated VolatilityKey current conditions:Funding rate: -6%Open interest: RisingLiquidations: $500M+Geopolitical risk: ElevatedThis combination reflects heightened speculative activity and a fragile market structure.With positioning heavily skewed short, Bitcoin’s next move could be amplified — whether through continued downside data.title: Cryptocurrency Industry Faces $35.7 Million Loss Due to Exploits in February

data.title: USDD 2.0 Supply Mining Phase XV Officially Begins
data.description: According to official news, JustLend DAO has officially launched Phase XV of its USDD 2.0 supply mining program. This phase began on February 28, 2026 at 20:00 (Singapore time) and will last until March 28. Users can participate by depositing $USDD into the platform. The annualized yield for this supply mining is approximately 5%, and rewards will be distributed weekly in USDD.
